discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
hosts are fault domains

questions.question_text:
A cloud administrator is managing a VMware Cloud environment consisting of a single cluster with two hosts.

The administrator is trying to create a new virtual machine and is getting the following error message:

Cannot complete file creation operation. There are currently 2 usable fault domains. The operation requires 3 more usable fault domains. Failed to create object.

What could be causing this issue?

choices.C: The VM storage policy is configured incorrectly for the cluster.
choices.A: There is insufficient CPU and memory based on the current virtual machine resource reservation settings.
choices.D: One of the hosts is in maintenance mode.
choices.B: vSphere Distributed Resource Scheduler (DRS) is enabled.

discussion.content:
If both are reachable over IP it should be a DNS issue on the cloud site.
My answer is D

Selected Answer: C
Step 4, part c: Under the Local Networks drop-down, select cgw-dns-network.

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Cloud-on-AWS/services/com.vmware.vmc-aws-operations/GUID-001CD09B-400A-4BCA-B8EF-283E085F1D30.html

questions.question_text:
A cloud administrator successfully configures a policy-based VPN between an on-premises data center and an instance of VMware Cloud software-defined data center (SDDC). Although the workloads are reachable from both locations over the IP network, the cloud virtual machines cannot access an on-premises web service.

What should the cloud administrator check first to resolve this issue?

discussion.content:
I think the answer is B and E. There is no mention of Global Cloud Admin in vmware documentation. 
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Cloud-on-AWS/services/com.vmware.vsphere.vmc-aws-manage-data-center-vms.doc/GUID-06B8A15B-4BE9-4236-8BEA-3F4F7C55D87A.html

questions.question_text:
A cloud administrator is tasked with deploying a new software-defined data center (SDDC) in VMware Cloud on AWS and has been able to log into the VMware Cloud console successfully. However, they cannot access the VMware Cloud on AWS service.

Which two tasks need to be performed for the administrator to gain access? (Choose two.)

choices.D: The cloud administrator will need the Administrator role in the VMware Cloud on AWS service.
choices.B: The cloud administrator will need to request access to the VMware Cloud on AWS service.
choices.A: The cloud administrator will need to create a new subscription for the VMware Cloud on AWS service.
choices.C: The cloud administrator will need the globalcloudadmin role in the VMware Cloud on AWS service.
choices.E: The cloud administrator will need the cloudadmin role in the VMware Cloud on AWS service.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
AI agrees with Kaylorm: "the maximum number of hosts in a cluster in the Google Cloud VMware Engine (GCVE) environment is 32. This means that a single cluster in GCVE can consist of up to 32 ESXi hosts."

Selected Answer: A
There is a limit of 32 hosts per cluster. Most viable option is A -- provision a new cluster

choices.B: Add seven hosts to the existing cluster.
choices.D: Nothing; the cluster will scale automatically.

questions.question_text:
A cloud administrator is managing a Google Cloud VMware Engine environment with a single cluster consisting of 28 hosts. The administrator needs to scale the environment and, based on estimates from the application team, requires seven additional hosts.

What should the administrator do?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
AI said: Given the requirement to collect and analyze security events from multiple sources, including VMware vSphere, Windows Operating Systems, physical servers, web servers, database servers, and AWS, VMware vRealize Log Insight Cloud would be a more suitable option.

Therefore, in this scenario, option C. VMware vRealize Log Insight Cloud is the best choice for meeting the requirement.

Selected Answer: D
CloudHealth Secure State is a cloud security and compliance management platform that allows users to reduce the risk and manage the security posture of their overall cloud environment

questions.question_text:
A cloud administrator is looking for a unified solution to collect and analyze security events for troubleshooting from:

• VMware vSphere
• Windows Operating Systems
• Physical servers
• Web servers
• Database servers
• Amazon Web Services

Which VMware Cloud service can meet this requirement?
